author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: The novel depicts the life of Prince Myshkin, a man of pure innocence, whose goodness and open-hearted simplicity lead many of the more worldly characters he encounters to mistakenly assume he lacks intelligence and insight. The story examines the complexities of love, politics, and social standing.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story about millionaire Jay Gatsby's passion and obsession for the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan, set in the roaring twenties.

author: Harper Lee
description: A novel set in the Deep South and a coming-of-age story that deals with serious issues like racial injustice and moral growth.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel depicting life under a totalitarian regime that practices extreme surveillance and public manipulation, exploring themes of freedom, truth, and betrayal.

author: J.D. Salinger44555
description: A novel about a couple of days in the life of a depressed and rebellious teenager, Holden Caulfield, who has just been expelled from prep school.
